tidbits.title: Remote and Uninhabited
tidbits.description: Heard Island and McDonald Islands are remote and uninhabited Australian territories, primarily known for their isolation and untouched natural environments.

tidbits.title: Unique Flora and Fauna
tidbits.description: Despite their harsh conditions, these islands host unique flora and fauna, including seabirds, seals, and mosses adapted to the extreme environment.

tidbits.title: Volcanic Activity
tidbits.description: Heard Island has an active volcano, Mawson Peak, the highest point in Australian territory, periodically erupting and reshaping the island's landscape.
